page.title: 17LIFESTYLES-TOURISM-THE PUB
page.content: The "Hunters Hall" pub dates back about 500 years with existing buildings up to 400 years old. It was a Coaching Inn, with stables, on the Gloucester-Bath turnpike road. Its site also includes the old Smithy and Village Hall. The road, now the A4135 from Dursley to Tetbury still brings customers from these two towns and from Nailsworth and Wotten-under-Edge, attracted by its reputation as a friendly free-house with excellent beers and historic buildings. The pub is used by local customers but would not be viable on village trade alone. The Hunter's Hall Retaurant is in the "Good Food Guide" and attracts custom from even further afield and provides a range of food from sandwiches to three course meals. It has a good reputation in the surrounding area.
